main.name: Luís Macedo
bio: Hello, my name is Luís Macedo. I'm 23 and from Portugal. Currently finishing my Master's in Computer Engineering and a Research grant, both on Computer Security.
My dissertation is to explore the capabilities of Arm TrustZone in a Robot Operating System 2 (ROS2) with the help of libddssec.
I'm very interested in cybersecurity and enjoy developing web applications, mainly the front-end.

skillmessage: Throughout my academic career, I was introduced to almost every topic in the software development area, such as multiple programming paradigms, assembly, networks, distributed systems, machine learning, web app development, cybersecurity, and databases.
I also introduced engineering themes, like, software systems planning,  economics, stock management, and statistics.

description: This course aims to prepare qualified engineers in all currently recognized phases of software development, such as software analysis, design, implementation, and installation.

work.company: INESC Technology and Science - Associate Laboratory
work.title: Research Assistant (Research Grant)
description: I am designing, implementing, and evaluating a prototype that capitalizes on security capabilities added by TrustZone (OP-TEE), namely attestation, to respond to the security challenges posed by the ROS2 and implement this solution in a real environment (on an ARM chip).

work.title: Software Engineer
description: In collaboration with Accenture, my group and I was tasked to improve an already built fleet management web app on the Google Cloud Platform. I implemented new features, mainly on the front-end, using ReactJS.
In addition, my group and I did research and wrote a technical report on optimizing current public transport services in a futuristic scenario based primarily on Machine Learning pipelines.

work.title: Software Developer Intern
description: Beginning of the development of a management platform in Laravel (PHP) and Vue.js.

In this course, I explored information security through some introductory material and gained an appreciation of the scope and context around the subject. More specifically, a brief introduction to cryptography, security management, and network and computer security.
I also learned key information security principles regarding information, confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

In this specialization, I learned basic security issues in computer communications, classical cryptographic algorithms, symmetric-key cryptography, public-key cryptography, authentication, and digital signatures.
In this course, I learned about threat modeling and cryptography concepts and how to create threat models and think critically about the threat models created by other people.

I additionally learned how attackers could exploit application vulnerabilities through the improper handling of user-controlled data, such as, injection problems in web applications (SQL injection, cross-site scripting, and command injection).
